description: a(n) = number of solutions to x_1 + x_2 + ... + x_n = x_{n+1} where each x_i is a factorial.
mathematica: f[n_, k_, m_] := (* # of partitions of n into k factorials <= m! *) Which[n==k, 1, m<=1||n<k|| n>k m!, 0, True, f[n, k, m]=f[n, k, m-1]+f[n-m!, k-1, m]]; a[n_] := Sum[f[r!, n, r-1], {r, 2, n}];
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jun 23 2001
